content:
This code chunk is part of the logic for managing animations within an object definition. It ensures that a specified animation name is added to the list of available animations if it doesn't already exist, loads the animation into the node path (likely a scene graph component), sets the animation as looping, updates the object's current animation state, and refreshes the UI properties to reflect the changes.

if animName not in objDef.anims:
                objDef.anims.append(animName)

            objNP.loadAnims({name:animName})
            objNP.loop(name)
            obj[OG.OBJ_ANIM] = animName
            self.editor.ui.objectPropertyUI.updateProps(obj)
